title: Bent's Old Fort National Historic Site: Permits & Reservations
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Permits & Reservations              Permits & Reservations        Guided Tour Reservation Information The park is open 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM with 10:30 AM and 1:00 PM guided tour times September through May and 8:00 AM to 5:30 PM with 9:30 AM, 11:00 AM, 1:00 PM and 2:30 PM tour times June through August. A short demonstration is included with the tour. Western National Parks Associaton's Bookstore offers videos, maps, and books for sale about the fort and the Santa Fe Trail. Plan on your visit lasting at least 2 hours. Call (719) 383-5026 for reservations. In recognition of the Centennial Anniversary of the National Park Service, Bent's Old Fort National History Site will not collect Living History fees during the 2016 Calendar year, but donations to support the Living History Program are appreciated.  There should be one adult for each 10 children if possible, to help direct and supervise the group.  Special Use Permits Permits are required for any activity that requires extended or special attention and/or may have a bearing on the resources.  This includes weddings, events, filming and photography.  For a long term special event of some kind, click here for the application for a special use permit.  For a short term special event, click here.  Click here for a long term film permit and here for a short term film permit.
